cursorPrompts.title: Duplicate Page Layout
cursorPrompts.content:
Create a new page at app/portfolio/page.tsx that copies the exact layout and structure of the Share Price page. Keep the functionality of everything that is inside the Admin panel, but apart from that - remove all functionality from all other buttons and dropdowns. Keep only the visual design and layout.

Specific changes:
- Page title: "New Page"
- Left section title: "Inputs"
- Right section title: "Outputs" 
- Navigation buttons: "Reset" and "Home"
- Remove all onClick handlers, API calls, and state management, apart from those in the Admin panel.
- Keep placeholder chart area and event boxes sections
- Replace dropdown options with: ["Option 1 / Option 2 / Option 3"] for first dropdown, ["Option A / Option B / Option C"] for second dropdown

Add navigation from the home page to this page, in an additional grid box.

rupertPrompts.title: Annotated Share
rupertPrompts.content:
For the stock chosen, get the share price, in weekly intervals, for the time period chosen, up to latest available share price.
In addition, find from newswire, 8 events which affected the share price, and show for them the data, and title of the event, in a single sentence.

rupertPrompts.title: Data Mapping
rupertPrompts.content:
You are a STRICT data mapper and editor. Output ONLY valid JSON (no markdown, no commentary). The JSON MUST parse.

INPUTS
- RAW_DATA: free-form company text between <RAW_DATA>‚Ä¶</RAW_DATA>.
- SCHEMA: JSON with topics[] ‚Üí subtopics[] ‚Üí keyQuestions[] between <SCHEMA>‚Ä¶</SCHEMA>.

GOAL
Map RAW_DATA into the SCHEMA‚Äôs topics/subtopics, evaluate each subtopic against its keyQuestions, and produce refined (edited-for-clarity) versions of ONLY the claims found in RAW_DATA. Never invent facts. If insufficient info exists, mark the subtopic as NA with a short reason.

DEFINITIONS
- ‚ÄúAnswered‚Äù subtopic = RAW_DATA provides concrete information that satisfactorily answers at least ONE keyQuestion for that subtopic (specific claims, metrics, named entities, clear statements of intent/process‚ÄîNOT vague vibes).
- ‚ÄúRefined‚Äù = grammar/tone tightened, concise, professional, preserving the exact meaning of the ‚Äúoriginal‚Äù sentence (no added numbers, names, claims, or dates).

PROCESS
1) Parse RAW_DATA into discrete, atomic data points (sentences/claims). Keep each as `original`.
2) For each subtopic in SCHEMA:
   ‚Ä¢ Determine if at least one keyQuestion is satisfactorily answered by RAW_DATA.
   ‚Ä¢ If YES ‚Üí status = "answered".
       - Collect all relevant sentences as dataPoints[]. For each, create a faithful `refined` version.
   ‚Ä¢ If NO ‚Üí status = "na" and include a brief `reason` (e.g., "no pricing details", "no customer metrics", "no competitors named").
3) Write a 2‚Äì3 sentence `summary` that synthesizes ONLY what appears in RAW_DATA (no speculation).
4) Compute topic-level completion:
   - answered = count of subtopics with status "answered"
   - total = total subtopics in that topic
   - percent = round(100 * answered / total)

OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT JSON)
{
  "version": "1.0",
  "summary": "<string>",
  "topics": [
    {
      "topicId": "<from SCHEMA>",
      "title": "<from SCHEMA>",
      "completion": { "answered": <int>, "total": <int>, "percent": <int> },
      "subtopics": [
        {
          "subtopicId": "<from SCHEMA>",
          "title": "<from SCHEMA>",
          "status": "answered" | "na",
          "reason": "<present ONLY if status==='na'>",
          "dataPoints": [
            { "original": "<verbatim sentence from RAW_DATA>", "refined": "<edited version, same meaning>" }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

RULES
- NO invented content. Use only what is explicitly present in RAW_DATA.
- If uncertain, prefer "na" with a concise reason.
- Keep JSON minimal and valid: no trailing commas; include empty arrays when needed; preserve keys and casing exactly as above.
- If a sentence is relevant to multiple subtopics, it may appear in multiple `dataPoints` lists.
- Do NOT include the RAW_DATA text wholesale in `summary`‚Äîsummarize concisely.

<RAW_DATA>
{{PASTE_USER_RAW_TEXT_HERE}}
</RAW_DATA>

<SCHEMA>
{{PASTE_SCHEMA_JSON_HERE}}
</SCHEMA>
